skill.name: reasoning-abductive
skill.description: Generate and evaluate explanatory hypotheses from incomplete observations. Use when diagnosing anomalies, explaining unexpected outcomes, or inferring causes from effects. Produces ranked hypotheses with evidence and confidence scores.
skill.summary: Generate and evaluate explanatory hypotheses from incomplete observations. Use when diagnosing anoma...
skill.author: BellaBe

security_audit.summary: Pure documentation skill with no executable code. All static findings are false positives: YAML field names misidentified as crypto algorithms, markdown backticks misidentified as shell execution, and a source URL misidentified as network access. This is a safe reasoning framework guide.

content.value_statement: Diagnose unexpected outcomes and anomalies by generating ranked explanations with evidence. This skill helps identify root causes when you have incomplete data and need to infer what happened.
actual_capabilities: Transform raw observations into structured anomaly descriptions
Generate diverse explanatory hypotheses across technical, product, market, and operational categories
Score hypotheses against evidence using explanatory power, simplicity, coherence, testability, and prior probability
Rank hypotheses with confidence scores and identify the most probable cause
Provide ranked output with supporting and contradicting evidence
Suggest next reasoning mode and testable actions
limitations: Does not access external data sources or perform live investigation
Requires user to provide initial observation data
Confidence scores are estimates based on provided evidence
Does not execute actions or run tests

use_cases.title: Debug Production Incidents
use_cases.description: Diagnose why metrics dropped or errors occurred when direct evidence is incomplete

use_cases.title: Explain Metric Changes
use_cases.description: Understand why conversion, engagement, or other business metrics changed unexpectedly

use_cases.title: Investigate Anomalies
use_cases.description: Generate candidate explanations for data anomalies and rank them by likelihood

prompt_templates.title: Basic Diagnosis
prompt_templates.prompt: Use abductive reasoning to explain this observation: [describe what happened, when, and the unexpected aspect]

prompt_templates.title: With Context
prompt_templates.prompt: Use abductive reasoning. Observation: [current situation]. Baseline: [expected state]. Help me generate hypotheses and evaluate them against available evidence: [list any data you have]

prompt_templates.title: Technical Issue
prompt_templates.prompt: Diagnose this technical anomaly using abductive reasoning. What I observed: [error, behavior, or metric change]. Available logs/data: [relevant information]. Generate and rank possible causes.

prompt_templates.title: Business Metric
prompt_templates.prompt: Apply the four-stage abductive process to this business metric change: [describe the metric, its historical baseline, and the current deviation]. Generate at least 5 hypotheses across technical, product, market, and operational categories. Score each against available evidence.

output_examples.input: Use abductive reasoning. Our enterprise conversion dropped from 15% to 9% last quarter. SMB remained stable at 12%.
output: Primary Cause: Sales cycle elongation + AM departures
Mechanism: Economic uncertainty extended CFO approval cycles by 45 days; AM departures created relationship gaps
Top Hypothesis: Website performance degradation (score: 0.78, confidence: 0.75)
Supporting Evidence: Page load time increased 2s in Q4, Mobile bounce rate up 15%
Next Actions: Wait 45 days to verify delayed deals close; Backfill AM roles

best_practices: Provide as much context and evidence as available to improve hypothesis scoring accuracy
Generate at least 5 hypotheses across different categories before evaluating them
Explicitly look for contradicting evidence to avoid confirmation bias
anti_patterns: Accepting the first plausible explanation without generating alternative hypotheses
Only seeking evidence that supports your preferred hypothesis
Stopping before completing all four stages when confidence is below 0.6

faq.question: What platforms is this skill compatible with?
faq.answer: This skill works with Claude, OpenAI Codex, and Claude Code. It is a prompt-based skill that provides structured reasoning templates.

faq.question: What data do I need to provide?
faq.answer: Provide the observation (what happened, when, how surprising), any baseline or context data, and available evidence for evaluation.

faq.question: Can I chain this with other reasoning skills?
faq.answer: Yes. Use abductive to diagnose, then switch to causal for execution or counterfactual to evaluate alternatives.

faq.question: Is my data stored or transmitted?
faq.answer: No. This is a pure prompt skill. Your observation data is only used to generate the reasoning output in your current session.

faq.question: Why are my confidence scores low?
faq.answer: Low confidence typically means limited evidence or conflicting data points. Gather more supporting evidence or refine the observation.

faq.question: How is this different from causal reasoning?
faq.answer: Abductive reasoning explains observations from effects to causes. Causal reasoning executes actions to achieve known outcomes.
